comments.author: Text
comments.created_time: July 27, 2023, 01:29:07 PMLast edit: July 27, 2023, 02:52:10 PM by Text
comments.body: Here are some long-term Bitcoin hodlers and their content that you might find interesting:Andreas Antonopoulos: Andreas is a well-known Bitcoin educator and author. He has been involved in the Bitcoin space since 2011 and has written several books on Bitcoin, including "Mastering Bitcoin" and "The Internet of Money." He also has a popular YouTube channel where he discusses Bitcoin and other topics related to cryptocurrencies.Twitter | YouTube | Podcast (What Bitcoin Did)Trace Mayer: Trace Mayer is known for popularizing the term "Hodl" (hold) in the crypto community. He has been a vocal proponent of Bitcoin for an extended period and often shares his insights on the long-term value proposition of Bitcoin in interviews, podcasts, and articles.Twitter | Podcast (What Bitcoin Did)Tone Vays: Tone is a Bitcoin trader and analyst. He has been involved in the Bitcoin space since 2011 and has a long track record of making accurate Bitcoin price predictions. He is also the founder of the Crypto-IQ trading academy, where he teaches people how to trade Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.Twitter | YouTube | Podcast (What Bitcoin Did)Max Keiser: Max is a Bitcoin proponent and host of the Keiser Report, a financial news show that focuses on Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. He has been involved in the Bitcoin space since 2011 and is a vocal advocate for Bitcoin adoption.Twitter | YouTube | Podcast (What Bitcoin Did)Peter McCormack: Peter is a Bitcoin podcaster and host of the What Bitcoin Did podcast. He has been involved in the Bitcoin space since 2013 and has interviewed many of the leading figures in the Bitcoin community. His podcast is a great resource for learning about Bitcoin from the expertsTwitter | YouTube | Podcast (What Bitcoin Did)Michael Saylor: As the CEO of MicroStrategy, Michael Saylor made headlines by converting a significant portion of his company's treasury reserves into Bitcoin. He frequently speaks about Bitcoin as digital gold and its role in preserving wealth over the long term.Twitter | YouTube | Podcast (What Bitcoin Did)Pomp (Anthony Pompliano): A popular figure in the cryptocurrency space, Pomp is a Bitcoin advocate and investor. He has a strong presence on social media platforms, where he shares insights and interviews with various Bitcoin enthusiasts.Twitter | YouTube | Podcast (What Bitcoin Did)I hope this helps!
